intro: Pedicularis hirsuta f. bracteosa, commonly known as the hairy lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. The bracteosa form is distinguished by its more pronounced bracts, which are modified leaves that surround the flower cluster.
